title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
01:19 <DrLou> has quit  
01:23 <jstoldt> has joined #xwiki  
01:25 <jstoldt|Notebook> has quit  
01:27 <evalica> has quit  
02:00 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
02:15 <DrLou> has quit  
02:28 <abusenius> has quit  
02:41 <jvdrean> has quit  
03:50 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
03:52 <venkatesh> has quit  
03:53 <venkatesh> has joined #xwiki  
05:06 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:55 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:58 <@sdumitriu> Hey mflorea  
06:58 <+mflorea> Hi sdumitriu  
06:58 <@sdumitriu> I didn't continue with the release yet  
06:58 <+mflorea> :)  
06:58 <@sdumitriu> Preparing the final commits  
06:59 <+mflorea> do you want me to continue?  
06:59 <+mflorea> I guess you didn't sleep :)  
06:59 <@sdumitriu> Yep, that would be nice  
06:59 <@sdumitriu> :)  
07:01 <+mflorea> sure, np, let me know when you finish and I'll continue the release. Have you looked at the release plan I made? let me know also if you're ok with it  
07:01 <@sdumitriu> I think I'm done with core  
07:02 <@sdumitriu> I have one commit in web, one in app/administration, and two in xe  
07:02 <@sdumitriu> If I didn't forget anything  
07:03 <+mflorea> I'll go eat something and I'll start afterwards  
07:20 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: I'm done with web as well  
07:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:49 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Done everything  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Follow/Unfollow implemented as well  
07:50 <@sdumitriu> (except for the correct message filtering in the activity stream)  
07:54 <sdumitriu> has quit  
07:55 <vmassol> nice  
08:19 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <vmassol> mflorea: good morning  
08:47 <vmassol> it seems sergiu didn't find the time to do the release yesterday night (I think he worked on followers instead). Do you think you could finish the release this morning?  
08:48 <vmassol> I've just rebuilt the whole XE from sources to do some quick testing but I need to go to an appointment now and I'll only be back in 1 hour. Maybe sburjan can help in quickly testing the latest changes from sergiu  
08:48 <vmassol> ?  
08:48 <+sburjan> should I download the latest build from maven ?  
08:48 <vmassol> if it built ye  
08:48 <vmassol> yes  
08:49 <vmassol> I don't know if it did since there seems to be some issues building the web modules  
08:49 <+sburjan> I only see a build from yesterday  
08:49 <+sburjan> 07-Mar-2011 05:29  
08:50 <+sburjan> any specific items you want me to test ?  
08:50 <+sburjan> because I have a meeting in 2 h  
08:50 <+sburjan> in 1 h  
08:53 <vmassol> wtachlist + activity stream  
08:54 <vmassol> new feature in watchlist: ability to watch people  
08:54 <vmassol> (ie docs modified by people)  
08:54 <vmassol> + the new user status (called message stream)  
08:54 <vmassol> (sburjan)  
08:54 <vmassol> got to go  
08:54 <vmassol> thanks  
08:54 <+sburjan> no problem. signal when you get back  
08:57 <tuxlover> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <tuxlover> good morning  
09:08 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:14 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
09:20 <+sburjan> @devs: any idea why the latest version isn't build ? Hudson is idle  
09:21 <+sburjan> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XAADMINISTRATION-233 waiting for this in the build  
09:24 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <+tmortagne> sburjan: i can see in hudson that the last administration build was 41min ago and it succeed  
09:25 <+tmortagne> you want the build of what ?  
09:25 <+tmortagne> XE ?  
09:26 <+tmortagne> for XE the problem is that it does not build  
09:26 <+tmortagne> there is an issue somewhere  
09:26 <+tmortagne> but you can get the admin app directly if you need  
09:29 <+sburjan> yes, there is some issue because I can't find it on maven  
09:29 <+sburjan> this is what I need ? http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/applications/xwiki-application-administration/2.0-SNAPSHOT/  
09:31 <+sburjan> works.. thanks  
09:33 <+mflorea> vmassol: I already talked with sergiu about continuing the release  
09:33 <+tmortagne> sburjan: let me check  
09:33 <+sburjan> I imported this : http://maven.xwiki.org/snapshots/org/xwiki/platform/applications/xwiki-application-administration/1.47-SNAPSHOT/  
09:33 <+sburjan> 2.0-SNAPSHOT didn't have a XAR built today, dunno what's the catch  
09:33 <+tmortagne> sburjan: not the right version  
09:33 <+tmortagne> 1.47-SNAPSHOT  
09:33 <+tmortagne> is the last one  
09:33 <+sburjan> yes  
09:33 <+sburjan> but what's the 2.0-SNAPSHOT there ?  
09:33 <+tmortagne> 2.0 has been wrongly created at some point and we come back to 1.x  
09:33 <+sburjan> I see  
09:33 <+sburjan> and why don't we remove it ?  
09:34 <+mflorea> tmortagne: what's the purpose of http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/ ?  
09:35 <+tmortagne> mflorea: for now nothing, i did not had time to finish it  
09:35 <+tmortagne> it's supposed to contains core translation as it should  
09:35 <+mflorea> ah, ok  
09:35 <+tmortagne> to sepaarate XE and core  
09:35 <+mflorea> right  
09:35 <+tmortagne> which would be cleaner  
09:36 <+tmortagne> but i need to write a refactoring script for that and it's pretty dangerous so did not took the time yet ;)  
09:37 <+mflorea> ok, on the same topic, we have an issue with the way Main.WebHome is translated because it doesn't contain only text content but code also. For instance Anca changed {{include document="Main.Dashboard"/}} to {{dashboard source="Main.Dashboard" /}}  and now I have to update all translations..  
09:39 <+mflorea> tmortagne: currently there's no other way right?  
09:40 <+tmortagne> mflorea: there is, find a way to make anca do it ;)  
09:40 <+mflorea> :) yeah  
09:41 <+tmortagne> but no technically there is no other way  
09:41 <+tmortagne> but i'm not kidding that much, changing the code of a translated page should imply changing its translations too  
09:42 <+mflorea> yes, Anca forgot about it  
09:50 <+mflorea> l10n.xwiki.org is painfully slow..  
09:52 <+tmortagne> yea need to change all tables for livetable another thing i did not had time to do  
09:52 <+mflorea> now it's not responding at all  
09:53 <+tmortagne> on which page ?  
09:53 <+tmortagne> any ?  
09:54 <+mflorea> any page, but now it's back up  
09:54 <+tmortagne> it's not supposed to be the wiki itself wich is slow but some pages are taking ages to show because they show too many informations which imply a lot of different requests  
09:56 <+mflorea> for instance I'm waiting for http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XE/MainWebHome?action=viewall&language=cs since a few minutes  
09:57 <+mflorea> and it should display just one key/value pair  
09:57 <+mflorea> for the page content  
10:00 <+tmortagne> then there is something weird  
10:01 <+tmortagne> since i never seen this kind of pages taking long time to show  
10:11 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <vmassol> back  
10:14 <vmassol> testing new features introduced by sergiu yesterday now  
10:16 <+jvelociter> vmassol: will you add commons and rendering to trunks ?  
10:16 <vmassol> jvelociter: what trunks?  
10:16 <vmassol> the platform one?  
10:17 <+jvelociter> yesterday ? you mean 2 hours ago  
10:17 <+jvelociter> we have several ?  
10:17 <vmassol> yes  
10:17 <vmassol> there's a commons trunks  
10:17 <+jvelociter> yes https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/trunks  
10:17 <vmassol> and a platform trunks  
10:17 <+jvelociter> ok  
10:17 <vmassol> I'm not sure  
10:17 <vmassol> we need to decide  
10:17 <vmassol> I talked briefly about this here  
10:17 <vmassol> and I think tmortagne wasn't sure either  
10:18 <vmassol> normally each top level project should not bring other top level projects I think  
10:18 <+tmortagne> commons is not platform, but we could have a top level trunks  
10:18 <vmassol> now we could have a top leveltrunks  
10:18 <vmassol> yep  
10:18 <+jvelociter> yes  
10:18 <+tmortagne> which get all others trunks  
10:18 <+jvelociter> ok  
10:18 <vmassol> just not very clean  
10:18 <vmassol> in term of directory  
10:18 <+jvelociter> ok just curiosity  
10:18 <+jvelociter> I will co commons and rendering :)  
10:18 <vmassol> since a top level trunks/ dir will be similar to a top level project named trunks  
10:19 <vmassol> I'm not srue it's necessary to have one  
10:19 <+tmortagne> the other way to see that is that a project can have in its trunks the trunks of its dependencies  
10:19 <vmassol> yes  
10:19 <vmassol> that's better  
10:20 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <+tmortagne> that way when you get XE trunk you have everything you need related to XE trunk  
10:20 <vmassol> we can have several svn externals per top level projects too  
10:20 <vmassol> one without transitive deps and one with transitivte deps  
10:20 <+tmortagne> yep  
10:20 <+tmortagne> probably better  
10:20 <vmassol> seems good  
10:22 <vmassol> jvelociter: I'm finishing testing the latest XE and I'll create the svn externals after  
10:22 <+jvelociter> sounds good  
10:23 <+jvelociter> thanks, nothing urgent from my side anyway  
10:24 <vmassol> mflorea: I noticed a missing translation, looking at it  
10:24 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XE-770  
10:26 <+mflorea> vmassol: sburjan` noticed too  
10:27 <vmassol> what I'm not sure is whether it should be a xe.activity.messages.\* or a xe.activity.action.\* key  
10:28 <vmassol> I'll keep it an xe.activity.action prop  
10:31 <vmassol> argh blocker…..  
10:31 <vmassol> registration doesn't work anymore  
10:31 <vmassol> ah wait  
10:32 <vmassol> my bad  
10:32 <vmassol> forget this  
10:32 <vmassol> pfew  
10:32 <vmassol> :(  
10:32 <vmassol> :)  
10:32 <vmassol> I had non matching passwords and the button wasn't doing anything  
10:33 <+sburjan> tmortagne, vmassol : it seems that importing administeration application is not enough. Activity Stream doesn't have the UI  
10:33 <vmassol> ok found bug in following  
10:33 <+sburjan> also watchlish live table isn't uopdated when I follow a user  
10:33 <vmassol> yes  
10:33 <vmassol> have you reported it?  
10:33 <vmassol> was going to do so  
10:33 <+sburjan> I am sorry, but I have a urgent issue now and I can't test further  
10:34 <vmassol> ok I'll report it  
10:34 <+sburjan> no, I didn't reported on JIRA anything  
10:38 <vmassol> done  
10:38 <vmassol> mflorea: are tests ok on hudson?  
10:38 <vmassol> checking  
10:39 <vmassol> hmm didn't run  
10:39 <vmassol> build is not working for some reason  
10:39 <vmassol> looking into it… no idea why it's failing ATM  
10:40 <+tmortagne> vmassol: XE seems to have the same issue than web  
10:40 <+mflorea> yes  
10:40 <+mflorea> java.lang.IllegalStateException: basedir <http://hudson.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-product-enterprise/ws/trunk/web/target/maven-shared-archive-resources/META-INF> does not exist  
10:40 <vmassol> I see a different errors on functional tests  
10:41 <vmassol> cannot find a dep  
10:41 <vmassol> anyway looking at it  
10:41 <vmassol> starting with web  
10:41 <vmassol> what version of mavne is used by hudson agents?  
10:42 <vmassol> it seems the remote resources plugin for licenses is not exectued for some reason  
10:43 <vmassol> but since there are sources (src/ dir) it should be executed normally  
10:43 <vmassol> tmortagne: we really need to fix those parseMessages deprecations in the console which we introduced a few releases ago....  
10:43 <vmassol> (on a different topic)  
10:43 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:43 <vmassol> (it's polluting our consoel logs)  
10:44 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <mflorea> has quit  
10:47 <vmassol> locally I can see:  
10:47 <vmassol> [INFO] --- maven-remote-resources-plugin:1.1:process (xwiki-license-resources) @ xwiki-web-standard ---  
10:47 <vmassol> but it's not executed on hudson  
10:47 <vmassol> my only guess is a differnet version of maven  
10:47 <vmassol> checking on agent  
10:48 <vmassol> Apache Maven 2.2.1  
10:48 <vmassol> ahah  
10:48 <vmassol> trying locally  
10:50 <vmassol> building  
10:50 <vmassol> if we find it doesn't work with 2.2.1 maybe we could mandate 3.x for maven?  
10:53 <vmassol> I can also fix the license stuff  
10:53 <vmassol> although I don't know how yet, except by cheating  
10:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: i tried with 2.2.1 already and i could not reproduce  
10:53 <+tmortagne> but even if that does not fix it shouldn't we start using maven 3  on hudson ?  
10:53 <vmassol> indeed  
10:53 <vmassol> the license is executed  
10:53 <vmassol> so it's a top level pom issue not being used maybe  
10:53 <vmassol> I'll force a rebuild of the top level pom  
10:53 <vmassol> hmm it's been built this morning  
10:53 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
10:53 <vmassol> oh I know  
10:53 <vmassol> I think  
10:54 <vmassol> if you run the build from web/standard then there's a src dir but if you run it from the reactor, say in web/ there's no src  
10:54 <vmassol> testing that locally  
10:57 <+tmortagne> you mean it's trying to take care of license for web. root pom ?  
10:57 <+tmortagne> but it's  failing in web-standard even on hudson  
10:59 <vmassol> what I've done is that i've enabled the creation of the license files  
10:59 <vmassol> only for projects having a src/ directory  
10:59 <vmassol> this is not perfect but that to prevent it from being executed on the top level pom  
10:59 <vmassol> s/that/that was/  
10:59 <vmassol> my guess is that when run in the reactor in 2.2.1 the directory that is checked  
11:00 <vmassol> is the current dir  
11:00 <vmassol> and not the dir of the module being built  
11:00 <vmassol> we need to find a better way  
11:00 <vmassol> but now that we've released license tool  
11:00 <vmassol> we can fix the top level pom easily  
11:01 <vmassol> but it's not a very good solution  
11:01 <vmassol> anyway it's better than my hack so I'll do that now  
11:06 <vmassol> should be ok now  
11:40 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
11:53 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:01 <+mflorea> vmassol: I see you fixed the build. Should I wait for Fabio/Edy to test the user status feature or can I proceed with the release?  
12:01 <vmassol> mflorea: you can proceed  
12:01 <+mflorea> ok  
12:01 <vmassol> whatever issue they find will be fixed for the RC  
12:14 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
12:23 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
12:30 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
12:31 <vmassol> has quit  
12:36 <lucaa> has quit  
12:41 <jstoldt> seriously, how long does it take for a newbie to remotely get an idea about the code?  
13:06 <venkatesh> has quit  
13:09 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: forever ?  
13:09 <jstoldt> good point!  
13:10 <+tmortagne> depends what you call a newbie  
13:10 <+tmortagne> a java and maven newbie left alone will probably take forever yes  
13:11 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: did you look at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Architecture ?  
13:11 <+tmortagne> that should help you a lot i think  
13:11 <jstoldt> great, thanks  
13:12 <+tmortagne> then you can map it with what you find in svn  
13:13 <+tmortagne> but XWiki is a big peace so it takes time to understand the whole thing  
13:15 <jstoldt> trying to... right now i'd already be pleased to just figure out where he xwiki syntax is read and parsed in order to create events such as onImage... but i keep running in circles...  
13:15 <jstoldt> i figured out it got to do with the listeners and what not... well... i think i am chocking a little with the complexity, to say the very least  
13:15 <+tmortagne> jstoldt: problem is that the xwiki syntax is persed in another project :)  
13:16 <+tmortagne> http://code.google.com/p/wikimodel/  
13:16 <+tmortagne> here it is  
13:16 <+tmortagne> s/persed/parsed/  
13:16 <jstoldt> oh... that explains a lot...  
13:17 <+tmortagne> then wikimodel events are converted into xwiki events  
13:17 <jstoldt> so all that is in the xwiki code is basically just wrapping and overriding?  
13:17 <+tmortagne> in https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/rendering/trunk/xwiki-rendering-syntaxes/xwiki-rendering-syntax-wikimodel/  
13:17 <jstoldt> yeah, been around there already  
13:18 <+tmortagne> yes but the parser as still been written by us (vmassol and me mostly) but in wikimodel  
13:18 <+tmortagne> that's open source beauty ;)  
13:19 <jstoldt> so when i enter [[image:img.png||parameterlist]] parameterlist will be parsed to a string which will then just be passed down as a parameter in the various functions?!  
13:20 <+tmortagne> no parameterlist is parsed as a Map it's not stay as string  
13:21 <+tmortagne> and it's parsed at wikimodel level  
13:21 <jstoldt> right, string list, forgot about that...  
13:21 <jstoldt> string map...  
13:22 <+tmortagne> btw is it ok with Eclipse to read code after all ?  
13:23 <+tmortagne> ( jstoldt )  
13:23 <jstoldt> yeah, i imported all of the projects at first but now cleaned it so just the top level project reside in the workspace  
13:23 <jstoldt> most of the names and structures are reasonably explaining so it's okay...  
13:24 <+tmortagne> ok  
13:25 <+mflorea> tmortagne: do you know why I get this http://pastebin.com/M3Xbp45A when running release:prepare on platform-core. The tag was created but it fails when updating the pom to 3.0-SNAPSHOT.  
13:26 <+mflorea> I don't see anything wrong on xwiki-model pom  
13:26 <jstoldt> anyway, thanks for the chat, this cleared a lot stuff up for me... until now it all was a bit too magic for me to proceed ;)  
13:26 <+tmortagne> mflorea: looking  
13:27 <+mflorea> so everything when fine up to the moment when the pom need to be "reverted" to 3.0-SNAPSHOT  
13:27 <+mflorea> s/when/went  
13:27 <+tmortagne> updating since i don't have the last version of svn  
13:29 <+tmortagne> mflorea:  could you paste the full log ?  
13:30 <+mflorea> it's quite long, I'll give you the last part  
13:30 <+tmortagne> or at least a bit more like the last built project  
13:30 <+tmortagne> yep  
13:31 <+tmortagne> mflorea: do you use maven 2 or 3 ?  
13:31 <+mflorea> here you go http://pastebin.com/fYVuVb5L  
13:31 <+mflorea> I'm on hudson agent machine  
13:31 <+mflorea> let me check  
13:32 <+tmortagne> it's 2.2.1 then  
13:32 <+mflorea> yep  
13:33 <+tmortagne> what happen when you execute release:prepare again ?  
13:33 <+tmortagne> (it will not try to redo it all, release plugin remember where it is)  
13:33 <+mflorea> let's see :)

13:34 <+tmortagne> never had issues at this step  
13:35 <+tmortagne> i think we upgraded release plugin recently maybe there is a bug  
13:35 <+mflorea> same http://pastebin.com/Aa65tBmL  
13:35 <+mflorea> let me try

13:36 <+tmortagne> -X is debug mode i think  
13:36 <+mflorea> doesn't say much http://pastebin.com/2gu5be03  
13:37 <+tmortagne> yea does not help much  
13:37 <+tmortagne> i found http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MRELEASE-217 but it's fixed

13:38 <+tmortagne> yea 2.1 so fixed since a long time

13:40 <+tmortagne> try -X maybe to see what it's doing when it fail

13:41 <+mflorea> ok,  
13:41 <+tmortagne> what i find weird is this "[INFO] Updating xwiki-core-model to 3.0-SNAPSHOT" comming from nowhere  
13:41 <+tmortagne> it's not the first project in the list  
13:42 <+tmortagne> maybe they introduce a bug with maven 2.x  
13:42 <+tmortagne> s/introduce/introduced/  
13:42 <rrodriguez> has quit  
13:42 <+mflorea> there are others before it when I use -X, just a sec  
13:43 <+mflorea> the last part http://pastebin.com/JgWjL4VP  
13:45 <+tmortagne> ok so looks like it does not like core-model pom but not much informations

17:08 <vmassol> :)  
17:09 <+cjdelisle> The reason asm is fast is because it's careful about memory lookups, that is possible in any lowish level language.  
17:09 <+cjdelisle> But seriously... A postprocessor can do just about 11MB/s in java and it could run in it's own thread.

17:11 <vmassol> % you add on top of the rendering time  
17:12 <vmassol> one feature of the rendering is that it has to be fast

17:18 <+cjdelisle> Oh, right. Not updated.

17:20 <+cjdelisle> hehe  
17:20 <@sdumitriu> Seriously, state machines are nice  
17:22 <+cjdelisle> This was asked before, the question boiled down to: Do you want each and every user to be allowed to add a section to admin just by creating a Configurable object?  
17:22 <+lucaa> but the message I get is in the administration section itself  
17:22 <+lucaa> not in the panel  
17:23 <+lucaa> it's about the annotations config

17:24 <+cjdelisle> There should be a mention in the main administration section that it is considered unsafe to show that section.

17:25 <+lucaa> I mean it doesn't help keeping the administration section clean and not messing it up  
17:25 <+cjdelisle> Well if we blackhole a section with no warning then it looks like something went horribly wrong and pages are not loading.  
17:25 <+lucaa> and why is that bad? the fact that any user can create a configurable object  
17:26 <+lucaa> ah, I think I know  
17:27 <+cjdelisle> If it were changed so that pages executed in their own context (the url is not /XWiki/XWikiPreferences ) when in a section, then it would be safe as the only attack would be to create millions upon millions of configuration sections.  
17:28 <+cjdelisle> ALso there's the $doc.save() trap but that is everywhere.  
17:28 <+lucaa> yeah, I get it now  
17:29 <+cjdelisle> I suppose it would be a nice addition to add a link to the page and tell the user that if it is safe then it should be saved by a permitted user (them) in order to be displayed.
